title: Lowest External Debt
description: In 2023, Iran had one of the lowest external debt stocks, amounting to only 2.45% of its Gross National Income (GNI).

title: Lowest Debt Service Ratio
description: Iran's total debt service was only 0.34% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income in 2023, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Present Value of External Debt
description: In 2023, the present value of Iran's external debt was just 1.67% of its GNI, indicating a very low debt burden.

title: High Net Foreign Assets
description: Iran had significant net foreign assets, totaling 2,473,743,911,927,340 LCU in 2016, indicating strong foreign reserves.

title: High Government Expenditure
description: In 2023, Iran's general government final consumption expenditure reached 18,422,330,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting substantial government spending.

title: High Household Consumption
description: Household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure in Iran was 71,941,643,000,000,000 LCU in 2023, indicating high consumer spending.

title: High GDP
description: Iran's GDP in 2023 was 143,039,267,000,000,000 LCU, showcasing a robust economy.

title: High GNI
description: In 2023, Iran's Gross National Income (GNI) was 142,872,444,650,948,000 LCU, reflecting a strong national income.

title: High Net Intake Rate in Grade 1
description: In 2017, Iran had a net intake rate in grade 1 of 99.98% for females, indicating almost universal enrollment at the start of primary education.

title: Low Labor Force Participation with Intermediate Education
description: In 2022, only 8.78% of Iran's female working-age population with intermediate education were part of the labor force, one of the lowest rates.
